text:
Yeah I just took a look at your stuff again! Really nice work! For real. Everything has a nice style and proportion to it. The Raven character has some good detail in it, and nice lighting. Well done.

Showing off that same great work in the reel which is fantastic. I'm sure you have heard it before but, very important to only show the best work, or the type of work you want to be getting. It is a bit long though I would condense that into 40-50 sec tops.. People looking at reels all day dont have the time to sit through the whole thing and will move on after 20sec unless you grab their attention and always lead and end with your best work.

The path to being an Art Director or Creative Director, lead artist whatever it may be, will look very different for everyone but as long as you are always advancing in style, technique,leadership skills,communication with your team and other creatives. you wil make it into whatever role you want.

I think without worrying to much about how to get into that role, because it is not something that will happen right away.. this obviously depends on a lot of factors but I'd say you probably have about 5-7 years before you hit an AD role. You'll get an intern/junior role somewhere and work your way up mid to senior to a lead or AD role.

The most important thing to keep in mind about advancing in this or really most industries is, yes having great work and skill is key.. but almost more importantly is having great communication skills and a good personality. At the end of the day the whole job is about communicating an idea to other artists or the end user and if you can't do that..well sorry.
And I can't tell you how many times a great artist is past over because they are rude or just overall jerks
You clearly are talented and that will only grow as time goes on. Always be striving to do better and to learn more there are so many resources out there as you know
and learn things outside of your focus.. knowing about different parts of the pipeline helps you know where you fit into it
and even outside the industry things will inform your art.. fashion, architecture, design, history all of it is inspiration that goes back into your work
but, that was alot of info and some broad strokes.. let me know if you want me to go into it more or if you have other questions. Hopefully I can answer them :slightly_smiling_face:

Thank you! This is great! Yeah. Right now I'm at a place where I want to definitely get better at modeling and look-dev, and all these technical skills, but also storytelling wise, and I was wondering how you approach that as an AD. I know it will take time like you mentioned but it would be nice to know.
Also I'm not sure if you'd like but maybe we can set up a zoom call instead? I don't mind, but I think it would be cool to discuss a topic if anything :smile:
